condition.description:
Muscle cramps are sudden, involuntary contractions or spasms in one or more of your muscles. They often occur after exercise or at night, lasting a few seconds to several minutes. It is a very common muscle problem.

Muscle cramps can be caused by nerves that malfunction. Sometimes this malfunction is due to a health problem, such as a spinal cord injury or a pinched nerve in the neck or back. Other causes are

  • Straining or overusing a muscle
  • Dehydration
  • A lack of minerals in your diet or the depletion of minerals in your body
  • Not enough blood getting to your muscles

Cramps can be very painful. Stretching or gently massaging the muscle can relieve this pain.
condition.name: Muscle spasm

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness, fatigue, and sleepiness.
Take the medication at the same time each day.
Not to be used for long-term treatment.
Don't drink alcohol while on this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Cyclobenzaprine is a muscle relaxer. It works in the brain to help calm down muscle spasms without interfering with normal muscle function.
basics.bottom_line: Cyclobenzaprine is widely used to treat muscle spasms and is available as a generic, but it shouldn't be used long-term.
downsides: Not recommended in elderly patients, people with glaucoma, or in people with recent heart issues (like rhythm problems, heart failure, or heart attack).

downsides_processed.orig: Not recommended in elderly patients, people with glaucoma, or in people with recent heart issues (like rhythm problems, heart failure, or heart attack).

upsides: Can relieve pain associated with muscle spasms.
Can be used by pregnant women.

upsides_processed.orig: Can relieve pain associated with muscle spasms.
Can be used by pregnant women.

userStories.tip: It was great until I had a baby and a full time job. I need to work!

It's best to take Flexeril at night because it does make you somewhat sleepy which is one case is a good thing if you're being kept up at night from painful chronic muscle spams. Effectiveness on spasms itself is so so.
Wish I would've know that I was going to be so knocked out. Wouldn't have taken it before Thanksgiving dinner!
Try to avoid taking this medication during the day as it can cause narcolepsy.
made me feel pretty loopy. couldn't possibly work while taking it. but it did the trick on my pulled back.
I was only able to take it at night, since it made me drowsy. I wouldn't drive for sure.
I took at night for the first few days. After my body was used to it I was able to take it during the day with a cup of coffee and was perfectly fine.

drugs.name: Flexeril

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness, fatigue, and sleepiness.
Take the medication at the same time each day.
Not to be used for long-term treatment.
Don't drink alcohol while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Taking Cyclobenzaprine along with other medications used for your mood, such as monoamine oxidase inhibitors and certain antidepressants, can make you more likely to have a serious condition called serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include sudden changes in your mental status (confusion and hallucinations), muscles (tremors and rigidity) and nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. Go to the emergency room or talk to your doctor immediately if you notice these symptoms. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you are unsure if your other medications will interact with Cyclobenzaprine.
risk_factors: Taking monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOI) 14 days before starting
Taking other medications for your mood

description_processed.orig: Taking Cyclobenzaprine along with other medications used for your mood, such as monoamine oxidase inhibitors and certain antidepressants, can make you more likely to have a serious condition called serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include sudden changes in your mental status (confusion and hallucinations), muscles (tremors and rigidity) and nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. Go to the emergency room or talk to your doctor immediately if you notice these symptoms. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you are unsure if your other medications will interact with Cyclobenzaprine.

risks_warnings.title: Dizziness and sleepiness
risks_warnings.description: Taking Cyclobenzaprine may make you feel dizzy or sleepy for the first few days, especially if you drink a lot of alcohol or take recreational drugs. Your body should adjust to this, however, avoid driving or other activities requiring concentration until you know how your body responds to the medication. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if these symptoms bother you.

description_processed.orig: Taking Cyclobenzaprine may make you feel dizzy or sleepy for the first few days, especially if you drink a lot of alcohol or take recreational drugs. Your body should adjust to this, however, avoid driving or other activities requiring concentration until you know how your body responds to the medication. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if these symptoms bother you.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Taking Cyclobenzaprine can make you more likely to have seizures, especially if you've had seizures before or are taking tramadol at the same time. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you are concerned.

description_processed.orig: Taking Cyclobenzaprine can make you more likely to have seizures, especially if you've had seizures before or are taking tramadol at the same time. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you are concerned.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness, fatigue, and sleepiness.
Take the medication at the same time each day.
Not to be used for long-term treatment (2 to 3 weeks maximum)
Don't drink alcohol while on this medication.
Can cause stomach pain, nausea and vomiting.

basics.benefits_moa: Soma is a muscle relaxant. It works in the brain to help calm down muscle spasms.
basics.bottom_line: Soma is widely used to treat muscle spasms and is available as a generic, but it's not considered a first-choice treatment for muscle spasms. It's also not meant for long-term therapy.
downsides: Not first line for treating muscle spasms.
Not meant for long term therapy.
Can cause dependence and withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it suddenly.

downsides_processed.orig: Not first line for treating muscle spasms.
Not meant for long term therapy.
Can cause dependence and withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it suddenly.

upsides: Available in two different strengths, although the smaller strength is only available as brand name and thus more expensive.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in two different strengths, although the smaller strength is only available as brand name and thus more expensive.

userStories.tip: most doctors don't realize the huge benefit and relief chronic pain patients get, despite the DEA being such a horses ass and keeping the drug on a very short leash.

drugs.name: Soma

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness, fatigue, and sleepiness.
Take the medication at the same time each day.
Not to be used for long-term treatment (2 to 3 weeks maximum)
Don't drink alcohol while on this medication.
Can cause stomach pain, nausea and vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Sleepiness and dizziness
risks_warnings.description: Taking Soma can make you feel sleepy and dizzy, especially if you're taking other medications that can also make you feel sleepy, or if you're taking recreational drugs or drinking too much alcohol. Avoid driving or doing other tasks that require concentration until you know how this medication affects you. Get up very slowly from a seated or lying down position.
risk_factors: Taking other medications that also cause sleepiness

description_processed.orig: Taking Soma can make you feel sleepy and dizzy, especially if you're taking other medications that can also make you feel sleepy, or if you're taking recreational drugs or drinking too much alcohol. Avoid driving or doing other tasks that require concentration until you know how this medication affects you. Get up very slowly from a seated or lying down position.

risks_warnings.title: Abuse, dependence and withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of abuse in people taking Soma. This has been rare and happens more likely in people who have had a history of drug abuse. Withdrawal symptoms have occurred in people who have taken large amounts of this medication for an extended period of time as well. Your doctor will work with you to see if alternatives can be recommended for you if this is a concern.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of abuse in people taking Soma. This has been rare and happens more likely in people who have had a history of drug abuse. Withdrawal symptoms have occurred in people who have taken large amounts of this medication for an extended period of time as well. Your doctor will work with you to see if alternatives can be recommended for you if this is a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of seizures in people taking Soma. However, this has been rare and only reported in people who were also overdosing on other medications, recreational drugs or alcohol.
risk_factors: Prior history of overdoses of drugs of abuse, recreational drugs or alcohol

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of seizures in people taking Soma. However, this has been rare and only reported in people who were also overdosing on other medications, recreational drugs or alcohol.

carousel_items: Good for short-term relief of anxiety symptoms.
Starts working in 30 minutes when swallowed.
Can cause temporary dizziness and drowsiness.
Addictive. Long-term use can cause dependence or abuse.
Not safe to use with alcohol.

basics.benefits_moa: Valium is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and muscle spasms, and causes sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Valium is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety and for pain and sleeplessness from muscle spasm. Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Processed by the liver, so might not be the best choice if you have liver problems.
Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

downsides_processed.orig: Processed by the liver, so might not be the best choice if you have liver problems.
Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

upsides: Effective at relieving short-term anxiety and sleeplessness.
Can be used together with antidepressants to manage anxiety disorders. Especially helpful for anxiety symptoms while you wait for an antidepressant to kick in (it can take several weeks).
Effective at relieving muscle spasms caused by a variety of conditions.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

Effective at relieving muscle spasms caused by a variety of conditions.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

userStories.tip:
Valium (Diazepam) is a complete medication. It works VERY well for the following,
-Anxiety
-Muscle Spasms 
-Detoxification (Benzos, alcohol, etc.)
-Insomnia 
-Agorphobia 
Etc...

I wish I'd have known that after taking it from age 16 to 38 for PTSD, I try not taking it I get migraines and dizzy and get sick soon as I take a few I'm normal. Been on them since a teen, still on 3 10mg a day
Take it in small dose before medical or dental procedures-- make me calmer
drinking with it is fine but it just makes you more drowsy.

Very effective for my Anxiety, Easy to use, No side effects.
Reducing off after 8yrs due to new concerns of alzheimer's risk. Worked very well for me when no other drugs would and got me through very tough times. Will still use as needed

drugs.name: Valium

carousel_items_processed.orig: Good for short-term relief of anxiety symptoms.
Starts working in 30 minutes when swallowed.
Can cause temporary dizziness and drowsiness.
Addictive. Long-term use can cause dependence or abuse.
Not safe to use with alcohol.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Valium for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Valium should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: If you use Valium for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Valium should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Valium suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Valium suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Valium can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Valium while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Valium can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Valium while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Valium impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Valium. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Valium impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Valium. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Memory problems
risks_warnings.description: Your brain may have difficulty making new memories while you're taking Valium.

description_processed.orig: Your brain may have difficulty making new memories while you're taking Valium.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Valium is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Valium is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects.
